Source code for babydragon.memory.kernels.multi_kernel

from typing import Dict

import numpy as np

from babydragon.chat.chat import Chat
from babydragon.memory.kernels.kernel_clustering import (
    HDBSCANPaths, SpectralClusteringPaths)
from babydragon.memory.kernels.memory_kernel import MemoryKernel
from babydragon.tasks.llm_task import LLMWriter



[docs]class MultiKernel(MemoryKernel):
    """
    Represents a group of MemoryKernels.

    `Attributes:`

    :attr:`memory_kernel_dict` : Dict[str, MemoryKernel]
        A dictionary of MemoryKernel instances.
    
    :attr:`path_group` : dict
        A dictionary to store the generated path groups.
    
    :attr:`name` : str
        The name of the MultiKernel.
    """



[docs]    def __init__(
        self,
        memory_kernel_dict: Dict[str, MemoryKernel],
        name: str = "memory_kernel_group",
    ):
        """
        Initialize the MultiKernel with a dictionary of MemoryKernel instances.

        Parameters
        ----------
        memory_kernel_dict : Dict[str, MemoryKernel]
            A dictionary of MemoryKernel instances.
        name : str, optional
            The name of the MultiKernel. Defaults to "memory_kernel_group".
        """
        self.memory_kernel_dict = memory_kernel_dict
        self.path_group = {}
        self.name = name




[docs]class HDBSCANMultiKernel(MultiKernel):
    """
    Represents a group of MemoryKernels clustered using HDBSCAN.

    `Attributes:`

    :attr:`cluster_paths` : HDBSCANPaths
        An instance of HDBSCANPaths to generate paths for the memory kernels.
    """


[docs]    def __init__(
        self,
        memory_kernel_dict: Dict[str, MemoryKernel],
        name: str = "memory_kernel_group",
    ):
        """
        Initialize the HDBSCANMultiKernel with a dictionary of MemoryKernel instances.

        Parameters
        ----------
        memory_kernel_dict : Dict[str, MemoryKernel]
            A dictionary of MemoryKernel instances.
        name : str, optional
            The name of the MultiKernel. Defaults to "memory_kernel_group".
        """

        super().__init__(memory_kernel_dict, name)
        self.cluster_paths = HDBSCANPaths()



[docs]    def generate_path_groups(self, num_clusters: int = None) -> None:
        """
        Generate path groups based on the provided number of clusters.

        If the number of clusters is not provided (``None``), the square root of the length 
        of the embeddings will be used as the number of clusters.

        Args:
            num_clusters (int, optional): The number of clusters. Defaults to ``None``.
        """
        path_group = {}
        for k, v in self.memory_kernel_dict.items():
            embeddings = v.node_embeddings
            if num_clusters is None:
                num_clusters = int(np.sqrt(len(embeddings)))
            paths = self.cluster_paths.create_paths(embeddings, num_clusters)
            path_group[k] = paths
        self.path_group = path_group




[docs]class SpectralClusteringMultiKernel(MultiKernel):
    """
    Represents a group of MemoryKernels clustered using Spectral Clustering.

    `Attributes:`

    :attr:`cluster_paths` : SpectralClusteringPaths
        An instance of SpectralClusteringPaths to generate paths for the memory kernels.
    """


[docs]    def __init__(
        self,
        memory_kernel_dict: Dict[str, MemoryKernel],
        name: str = "memory_kernel_group",
    ):
        """
        Initialize the SpectralClusteringMultiKernel with a dictionary of MemoryKernel instances.

        Parameters
        ----------
        memory_kernel_dict : Dict[str, MemoryKernel]
            A dictionary of MemoryKernel instances.
        name : str, optional
            The name of the MultiKernel. Defaults to "memory_kernel_group".
        """
        super().__init__(memory_kernel_dict, name)
        self.cluster_paths = SpectralClusteringPaths()



[docs]    def generate_path_groups(self, num_clusters: int = None) -> None:
        """
        Generate path groups based on the provided number of clusters.

        If the number of clusters is not provided (``None``), the square root of the length 
        of the embeddings will be used as the number of clusters.

        Args:
            num_clusters (int, optional): The number of clusters. Defaults to ``None``.
        """
        path_group = {}
        for k, v in self.memory_kernel_dict.items():
            A_k = v.A_k
            if num_clusters is None:
                num_clusters = int(np.sqrt(len(A_k)))
            paths = self.cluster_paths.create_paths(A_k, num_clusters)
            path_group[k] = paths
        self.path_group = path_group
